comments: a(n) = product of first n terms of an arithmetic progression with first term n and common difference n. E.g. a(3) = 3*6*9 = 162. - _Amarnath Murthy_, Sep 20 2003
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100
maple: with (combinat):seq(mul(sum(binomial(k+1,k),j=0..n), k=0..n), n=0..13); # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jun 02 2007seq(mul(j*n,j=1..n), n=0..14); # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jun 02 2007a:=n->mul(sum(k, j=1..n),k=1..n): seq(a(n), n=0..14); # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jun 02 2007
mathematica: lst={}; Do[AppendTo[lst,Floor[n!*n^n]],{n,5!}]; lst [_Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Jan 15 2009]
prog: (PARI) { for (n=1, 100, write("b061711.txt", n, " ", n!*n^n) ) } [_Harry J. Smith_, Jul 26 2009]
crossrefs: Cf. A053042, A036679, A055775. - _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Jan 15 2009
author: Lorenzo Fortunato (fortunat(AT)pd.infn.it), Jun 19 2001
